intro: Psammotropha anguina, commonly known as the sandhill tamarisk, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Tamaricaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. It is well adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate drought conditions. Psammotropha anguina plays a role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for various desert organisms.
